explanation:
code_hardening: Added null checks for the ObjectOutputStream and the mCookie instance to prevent NullPointerExceptions and ensure predictable serialization output when the cookie is absent.
resolve_compilation_errors: Removed any Android-specific dependencies by relying solely on java.io.ObjectOutputStream and java.net.HttpCookie APIs; accessed all cookie attributes through standard HttpCookie getters that are available in the JDK.
exception_handling: Declared IOException on the method signature to propagate standard Java serialization errors, aligning with ObjectOutputStream contract; avoided Android-specific exception patterns.
logic_customization: Replaced constructor-based SharedPreferences loading with Java serialization logic that writes a single HttpCookieâ€™s explicit fields in a fixed order matching readObject, eliminating iteration, maps, and encoding/decoding.
refactoring: Simplified responsibility to single-cookie serialization only, removed any need for maps or preference keys, and kept logic contained within this method without additional helpers.
misc: Added minimal inline comments and a flush call to reflect standard Java serialization behavior; no new custom API calls were introduced.
